    Describes if the polygon isclosed or not.
  • MEItemLayer * m_itemLayer
    The itemlayer where this drawable is located.

Detailed Description

Class that describes one drawable on the map.

Have methods that draws the item in a window and to highlight it in different ways.

Definition at line 153 of file MEItemLayer.h.

Create a new drawable.

Parameters:
thePoints The points that this drawable consists of.
nbrCoord The number of coordinates in thePoints-array.
closed Boolean that determine if this drawable should be drawn as an open or closed polygon.

Get the bounding box of this drawable.

Parameters:
maxX Outparameter that is set to the maximum X-value.
minX Outparameter that is set to the minimum X-value.
maxY Outparameter that is set to the maximum Y-value.
minY Outparameter that is set to the minimum y-value.

Glib::RefPtr< Gdk::Window > &  w,
uint32  i
) 
 

Highlight one of the coordinates in this drawable.

Parameters:
gc The graphics context that will be used to highlight the node.
w The window where this drawable will be draw.
i The index of the coordinate to highlight. Valid values are 0 <= i < m_nbrPoints.

void MEItemLayer::MEDrawableItem::locate (  Glib::RefPtr< Gdk::GC > &  gc,
Gdk::Window &  w
) 
 

Locate this item by drawing e.g.

a big square or circle around it.

Parameters:
gc The graphics context that will be used to draw this drawable.
w The window where this drawable will be draw.
r The radius or side, in pixels, of the circle or square to draw (optional parameter).

MEItemLayer* MEItemLayer::MEDrawableItem::m_itemLayer [private]
 

The itemlayer where this drawable is located.

To make is possible to access members in that class when drawing the item, e.g. m_filled.

std::vector<Gdk::Point> MEItemLayer::MEDrawableItem::m_points [private]
 

An array with the points that describes this drawable.

The size of this array is m_nbrPoints.
